column4: ok llutz_ .. that's what I thought. He told me to be careful to mount a ext HDD once linux is running (hotswapping).. I don't know what he meant so i thought I would research it. He suggests I boot up with all the drives attached to the system ahead of time llutz_
sorry for repeating your nick twice
nice to know!!!! great I will document that in my KB
you can mount an external drive anytime, just don't unplug it without unmounting first
the shutdown process includes unmounting all drives, so that'd be fine
try getting to console (CTRL+ALT+F1), try ssh'ing in, REISUB
ssh ing into the system you mean via ssh????
yep, sometimes if graphics are frozen I can still get in via ssh and kill the offending process
you mean via TTY..? SSH is a secure shell.. via remote computer you mean?
yeah remotely, I use my phone to ssh in
it means processes in the background
so it's nothing to worrry about?
change provider
wifi, not internet
remove
it says in apt-get man page
no prob
just food for thought, try to bring your laptop close to your router and see if this will fix your slow speed issue
it used to do 1MB/s till I upgraded ubuntu, its within 20' of the router
.... I keep being told its not good to upgrade.. it's not up to par.. I dont know if that is your issue but
yeah nothing goes over 150K
